intro: Ficus basarensis, commonly known as the Basarénsis fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Mexico and is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by edible figs that are typically green when mature. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. Ficus basarensis prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor cultivation.
